page.title: 13TRANSPORT ON THE M5
page.content: The{M5 motorway}crosses our D Block in the a northeast to southwest direction. It was built in the late 1960's and goes as far as{Exeter}in the south west and{Birmingham}to the north east. It is therefore very important for the{industry}in Avonmouth and Severnside as well as taking{holiday traffic}to Devon and Cornwall in the summer months. The motorway crosses the River Avon using Avonmouth Bridge and many of our pupils from Weston-Super-Mare, Clevedon and Portishead use it every day to get to St. Bedes. Our class did a{survey}from a motorway bridge on the traffic using the M5 on Monday 1st July l985 - 9.45am to 10.15am. There are 3 lanes in each direction: CARS TRUCKS+VANS Going SOUTH 186 180 St. Bedes Going NORTH 354 204 School
